meanings.definition: In a manner showing a desire to equal or surpass others.
meanings.sent1: She ran emulously in the race, trying to beat her own record.
meanings.sent2: He worked emulously to finish the project before the deadline.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel emulously gathered nuts, hoping to have the biggest stash in the forest.
meanings.sent4: The flowers bloomed emulously, each one trying to outshine the others.
meanings.sent5: The students studied emulously for the exam, each one aiming for the top score.

meanings.definition: Acting in a competitive or ambitious way.
meanings.sent1: The emulously ambitious entrepreneur started multiple businesses.
meanings.sent2: She had an emulously competitive spirit, always striving to be the best.
meanings.sent3: The emulously determined athlete trained hard to win the championship.
meanings.sent4: The emulously driven student pursued excellence in all her endeavors.
meanings.sent5: His emulously ambitious nature led him to seek success in every aspect of his life.
